001package gust.backend.model;
002
003import com.google.common.annotations.VisibleForTesting;
004import com.google.common.base.CharMatcher;
005import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSortedSet;
006import com.google.errorprone.annotations.CanIgnoreReturnValue;
007import com.google.protobuf.DescriptorProtos.FieldOptions;
008import com.google.protobuf.DescriptorProtos.MessageOptions;
009import com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.Descriptor;
010import com.google.protobuf.Descriptors.FieldDescriptor;
011import com.google.protobuf.FieldMask;
012import com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage.GeneratedExtension;
013import com.google.protobuf.Message;
014import com.google.protobuf.util.FieldMaskUtil;
015import tools.elide.core.Datamodel;
016import tools.elide.core.DatapointType;
017import tools.elide.core.FieldType;
018
019import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
020import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
021import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
022import java.io.Serializable;
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListSet;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.stream.Collectors;
027import java.util.stream.Stream;
028
029
030/**
031 * Utility helper class, which is responsible for resolving metadata (based on the core framework annotations) from
032 * arbitrary model definitions.
033 *
034 * <p>Model "metadata," in this case, refers to annotation-based declarations on the protocol buffer definitions
035 * themselves. As such, the source for most (if not all) of the data provided by this helper is the {@link Descriptor}
036 * that accompanies a Java-side protobuf model.</p>
037 *
038 * <p><b>Note:</b> Using this class, or the model layer writ-large, requires the full runtime Protobuf library (the lite
039 * runtime for Protobuf in Java does not include descriptors at all, which this class relies on).</p>
040 */
041@ThreadSafe
042@SuppressWarnings({"WeakerAccess", "unused"})
043public final class ModelMetadata {
044  private ModelMetadata() { /* Disallow construction. */ }
045
046  /** Utility class that points to a specific field, in a specific context. */
047  @Immutable
048  @ThreadSafe
049  public final static class FieldPointer implements Serializable, Comparable<FieldPointer> {
050    /** Depth of this field, based on the number of dots in the path. */
051    private final @Nonnull Integer depth;
052
053    /** Access path to the field in some context. */
054    private final @Nonnull String path;
055
056    /** Base model type. */
057    private final @Nonnull Descriptor base;
058
059    /** Field descriptor for the field in question. */
060    private final @Nonnull FieldDescriptor field;
061
062    /**
063     * Setup a new field pointer - generally kept private and resolved via {@link ModelMetadata}.
064     *
065     * @param base Base model type where {@code path} begins.
066     * @param path Dotted-path to the field in question.
067     * @param field Field descriptor for the field in question.
068     */
069    FieldPointer(@Nonnull Descriptor base,
070                 @Nonnull String path,
071                 @Nonnull FieldDescriptor field) {
072      this.path = path;
073      this.base = base;
074      this.field = field;
075      this.depth = CharMatcher.is('.').countIn(path);
076    }
077
078    /** {@inheritDoc} */
079    @Override
080    public boolean equals(Object o) {
081      if (this == o) return true;
082      if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
083      FieldPointer that = (FieldPointer) o;
084      return this.depth.equals(that.depth)
085        && com.google.common.base.Objects.equal(path, that.path)
086        && com.google.common.base.Objects.equal(base.getFullName(), that.base.getFullName());
087    }
088
089    /** {@inheritDoc} */
090    @Override
091    public int hashCode() {
092      return com.google.common.base.Objects
093        .hashCode(path, base.getFullName());
094    }
095
096    /** {@inheritDoc} */
097    @Override
098    public int compareTo(@Nonnull FieldPointer other) {
099      return this.path.compareTo(other.path);
100    }
101
102    /** {@inheritDoc} */
103    @Override
104    public String toString() {
105      return "FieldPointer{" +
106        "base='" + base.getName() + '\'' +
107        ", path=" + path +
108        '}';
109    }
110
111    /** @return Path to the specified field. */
112    public @Nonnull String getPath() {
113      return path;
114    }
115
116    /** @return Simple proto name for the field. */
117    public @Nonnull String getName() {
118      return field.getName();
119    }
120
121    /** @return Simple JSON name for the field. */
122    public @Nonnull String getJsonName() {
123      return field.getJsonName();
124    }
125
126    /** @return Base model type where the specified path begins. */
127    public @Nonnull Descriptor getBase() {
128      return base;
129    }
130
131    /** @return Descriptor for the targeted field. */
132    public @Nonnull FieldDescriptor getField() {
133      return field;
134    }
135  }
136
137  /** Utility class that holds a {@link FieldPointer} and matching field value. */
138  public final static class FieldContainer<V> implements Serializable, Comparable<FieldContainer<V>> {
139    /** Pointer to the field which holds this value. */
140    private final @Nonnull FieldPointer field;
141
142    /** Value for the field, if found. */
143    private final @Nonnull Optional<V> value;
144
145    /**
146     * Setup a new field pointer - generally kept private and resolved via {@link ModelMetadata}.
147     *
148     * @param field Pointer to the field that holds this value.
149     * @param value Value extracted for the specified field.
150     */
151    FieldContainer(@Nonnull FieldPointer field,
152                   @Nonnull Optional<V> value) {
153      this.field = field;
154      this.value = value;
155    }
156
157    /** {@inheritDoc} */
158    @Override
159    public boolean equals(Object o) {
160      if (this == o) return true;
161      if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
162      FieldContainer<?> that = (FieldContainer<?>) o;
163      return field.equals(that.field)
164        && (value.isPresent() == that.value.isPresent())
165        && (value.equals(that.value));
166    }
167
168    /** {@inheritDoc} */
169    @Override
170    public int hashCode() {
171      return com.google.common.base.Objects
172        .hashCode(field, value);
173    }
174
175    /** {@inheritDoc} */
176    @Override
177    public int compareTo(@Nonnull FieldContainer<V> other) {
178      return this.field.compareTo(other.field);
179    }
180
181    /** {@inheritDoc} */
182    @Override
183    public String toString() {
184      return "FieldContainer{" +
185        "" + field.base.getName() +
186        ", path=" + field.path +
187        ", hasValue=" + value.isPresent() +
188        '}';
189    }
190
191    /** Pointer to the field holding the specified value. */
192    public @Nonnull FieldPointer getField() {
193      return field;
194    }
195
196    /** Value associated with the specified field, or {@link Optional#empty()} if the field has no initialized value. */
197    public @Nonnull Optional<V> getValue() {
198      return value;
199    }
200  }
201
202  // -- Internals -- //
203
204  /**
205   * Resolve a model field within the tree of {@code descriptor}, where an instance of annotation data of type
206   * {@code ext} is affixed to the field. If the (optional) provided {@code filter} function agrees, the item is
207   * returned to the caller in a {@link FieldPointer}.
208   *
209   * <p>If the field cannot be found, no exception is raised, and {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. The search may
210   * also be conducted in {@code recursive} mode, which proceeds to examine sub-messages if the requested field cannot
211   * be located on the top-level {@code descriptor}.</p>
212   *
213   * @param descriptor Descriptor where we should begin our search for the desired property.
214   * @param ext Extension the field is annotated with. Only fields annotated with this extension are eligible.
215   * @param recursive Whether to search recursively, or just on the top-level instance.
216   * @param filter Filter function to dispatch per-found-field. The first one to return {@code true} wins.
217   * @param stack Property stack, filled out as we recursively descend.
218   * @param <E> Generic type of the model extension object.
219   * @return Optional, containing either a resolved {@link FieldPointer}, or empty.
220   */
221  @VisibleForTesting
222  static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> resolveAnnotatedField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
223                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext,
224                                                                   @Nonnull Boolean recursive,
225                                                                   @Nonnull Optional<Function<E, Boolean>> filter,
226                                                                   @Nonnull String stack) {
227    Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor, "Cannot resolve field from `null` descriptor.");
228    Objects.requireNonNull(ext, "Cannot resolve field from `null` descriptor.");
229    Objects.requireNonNull(recursive, "Cannot pass `null` for `recursive` flag.");
230    Objects.requireNonNull(filter, "Pass empty optional, not `null`, for field filter parameter.");
231    Objects.requireNonNull(stack, "Recursive property stack should not be `null`.");
232
233    for (FieldDescriptor field : descriptor.getFields()) {
234      if (field.getOptions().hasExtension(ext)) {
235        var extension = field.getOptions().getExtension(ext);
236        if (!filter.isPresent() || filter.get().apply(extension))
237          return Optional.of(new FieldPointer(
238            descriptor,
239            stack.isEmpty() ? field.getName() : stack + "." + field.getName(),
240            field));
241      }
242
243      // should we recurse?
244      if (recursive && field.getType() == FieldDescriptor.Type.MESSAGE) {
245        // if so, append the current prop to the stack and give it a shot
246        //noinspection ConstantConditions
247        var sub = resolveAnnotatedField(
248          field.getMessageType(),
249          ext,
250          recursive,
251          filter,
252          stack.isEmpty() ? field.getName() : stack + "." + field.getName());
253        if (sub.isPresent())
254          return sub;
255      }
256    }
257    return Optional.empty();
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * Resolve a model field within the tree of {@code descriptor}, identified by the specified deep {@code path}. If the
262   * (optional) provided {@code filter} function agrees, the item is returned to the caller in a {@link FieldPointer}.
263   *
264   * <p>If the field cannot be found, no exception is raised, and {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. The search may
265   * also be conducted in {@code recursive} mode, which proceeds to examine sub-messages if the requested field cannot
266   * be located on the top-level {@code descriptor}.</p>
267   *
268   * @param original Top-level descriptor where we should begin our search for the desired property.
269   * @param descriptor Current-level descriptor we are scanning (for recursion).
270   * @param path Deep dotted-path to the field we are being asked to resolve.
271   * @param remaining Remaining segments of {@code path} to follow/compute.
272   * @return Optional, containing either a resolved {@link FieldPointer}, or empty.
273   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the provided path is syntactically invalid.
274   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If an attempt is made to access a property on a primitive field.
275   */
276  @VisibleForTesting
277  static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> resolveArbitraryField(@Nonnull Descriptor original,
278                                                               @Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
279                                                               @Nonnull String path,
280                                                               @Nonnull String remaining) {
281    Objects.requireNonNull(original, "Cannot resolve field from `null` descriptor.");
282    Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor, "Cannot resolve field from `null` descriptor.");
283    Objects.requireNonNull(path, "Cannot resolve field from `null` path.");
284    Objects.requireNonNull(remaining, "Recursive remaining stack should not be `null`.");
285
286    if (remaining.startsWith(".") || remaining.endsWith(".") || remaining.contains(" "))
287      throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("Invalid deep-field path '%s'.", path));
288    if (!remaining.contains(".")) {
289      // maybe we're lucky and don't need to recurse
290      for (FieldDescriptor field : descriptor.getFields()) {
291        if (remaining.equals(field.getName())) {
292          return Optional.of(new FieldPointer(
293            original,
294            path,
295            field));
296        }
297      }
298    } else {
299      // need to recurse
300      String segment = remaining.substring(0, remaining.indexOf("."));
301      var messageField = descriptor.findFieldByName(segment);
302      if (messageField != null && messageField.getType() == FieldDescriptor.Type.MESSAGE) {
303        // found the next tier
304        var subType = messageField.getMessageType();
305        String newRemainder = remaining.substring(remaining.indexOf(".") + 1);
306        return resolveArbitraryField(
307          original,
308          subType,
309          path,
310          newRemainder);
311      } else if (messageField != null) {
312        // it's not a message :(
313        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
314          String.format(
315            "Cannot access sub-field of primitive leaf field, at '%s' on model type '%s'.",
316            path,
317            original.getName()));
318      }
319    }
320    // property not found
321    return Optional.empty();
322  }
323
324  /**
325   * Splice an arbitrary field {@code value} at {@code path} into the provided {@code builder}. If an empty value
326   * ({@link Optional#empty()}) is provided, clear any existing value residing at {@code path}. In all cases, mutate the
327   * existing {@code builder} rather than returning a copy.
328   *
329   * @param original Top-level builder, which we hand back at the end.
330   * @param builder Builder to splice the value into and return.
331   * @param path Path at which the target property resides.
332   * @param value Value which we should set the target property to, or clear (if passed {@link Optional#empty()}).
333   * @param remaining Remaining properties to recurse down to. Internal use only.
334   * @param <Builder> Builder type which we are operating on for this splice.
335   * @param <Value> Value type which we are operating with for this splice.
336   * @return Provided {@code builder} after being mutated with the specified property value.
337   */
338  @VisibleForTesting
339  static <Builder extends Message.Builder, Value> Builder spliceArbitraryField(@Nonnull Message.Builder original,
340                                                                               @Nonnull Message.Builder builder,
341                                                                               @Nonnull String path,
342                                                                               @Nonnull Optional<Value> value,
343                                                                               @Nonnull String remaining) {
344    Objects.requireNonNull(builder, "Cannot splice field into `null` builder.");
345    Objects.requireNonNull(path, "Cannot resolve field from `null` path.");
346    Objects.requireNonNull(remaining, "Recursive remaining stack should not be `null`.");
347    Objects.requireNonNull(value, "Pass an empty optional, not `null`, for value.");
348
349    var descriptor = builder.getDescriptorForType();
350    if (!remaining.isEmpty() && !remaining.contains(".")) {
351      // thankfully, no need to recurse
352      var field = Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor.findFieldByName(remaining));
353      if (value.isPresent()) {
354        try {
355          builder.setField(field, value.get());
356        } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
357          throw new ClassCastException(String.format(
358            "Failed to set field '%s': value type mismatch.",
359            path));
360        }
361      } else {
362        builder.clearField(field);
363      }
364      //noinspection unchecked
365      return (Builder)original;
366    } else {
367      // we have a sub-message that is initialized, so we need to recurse.
368      String segment = remaining.substring(0, remaining.indexOf("."));
369      String newRemainder = remaining.substring(remaining.indexOf(".") + 1);
370      return spliceArbitraryField(
371        original,
372        builder.getFieldBuilder(Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor.findFieldByName(segment))),
373        path,
374        value,
375        newRemainder);
376    }
377  }
378
379  @VisibleForTesting
380  static @Nonnull <V> FieldContainer<V> pluckFieldRecursive(@Nonnull Message original,
381                                                            @Nonnull Message instance,
382                                                            @Nonnull String path,
383                                                            @Nonnull String remaining) {
384    Objects.requireNonNull(original, "Cannot resolve field from `null` descriptor.");
385    Objects.requireNonNull(instance, "Cannot resolve field from `null` instance.");
386    Objects.requireNonNull(path, "Cannot resolve field from `null` path.");
387    Objects.requireNonNull(remaining, "Recursive remaining stack should not be `null`.");
388
389    var descriptor = instance.getDescriptorForType();
390    if (remaining.startsWith(".") || remaining.endsWith(".") || remaining.contains(" ")) {
391      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot begin or end model property path with `.`");
392    } else if (!remaining.isEmpty() && !remaining.contains(".")) {
393      // we got lucky, no need to recurse
394      var field = descriptor.findFieldByName(remaining);
395      if (field != null) {
396        if (field.getType() == FieldDescriptor.Type.MESSAGE) {
397          Message modelInstance = (Message)instance.getField(field);
398          //noinspection unchecked
399          return new FieldContainer<>(
400            new FieldPointer(descriptor, path, field),
401            !modelInstance.getAllFields().isEmpty() ? Optional.of((V)modelInstance) : Optional.empty());
402        } else {
403          //noinspection unchecked
404          return new FieldContainer<>(
405            new FieldPointer(descriptor, path, field),
406            Optional.of((V) instance.getField(field)));
407        }
408      }
409    } else {
410      // find next segment
411      String segment = remaining.substring(0, remaining.indexOf("."));
412      var messageField = descriptor.findFieldByName(segment);
413      if (messageField != null && messageField.getType() == FieldDescriptor.Type.MESSAGE) {
414        if (!instance.hasField(messageField)) {
415          // there is a sub-message that is not initialized. so the field is technically empty.
416          return new FieldContainer<>(
417            new FieldPointer(original.getDescriptorForType(), path, messageField),
418            Optional.empty());
419        } else {
420          // we have a sub-message that is initialized, so we need to recurse.
421          String newRemainder = remaining.substring(remaining.indexOf(".") + 1);
422          return pluckFieldRecursive(
423            original,
424            (Message)instance.getField(messageField),
425            path,
426            newRemainder);
427        }
428      } else if (messageField != null) {
429        // it's not a message :(
430        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
431          String.format(
432            "Cannot access sub-field of primitive leaf field, at '%s' on model type '%s'.",
433            path,
434            original.getDescriptorForType().getName()));
435      }
436    }
437    throw new IllegalArgumentException(
438      String.format("Failed to locate field '%s' on model type '%s'.", path, descriptor.getName()));
439  }
440
441  // -- Metadata: Qualified Names -- //
442
443  /**
444   * Resolve the fully-qualified type path, or name, for the provided datamodel type descriptor. This is essentially
445   * syntactic sugar.
446   *
447   * @param descriptor Model descriptor to resolve a fully-qualified name for.
448   * @return Fully-qualified model type name.
449   */
450  public static @Nonnull String fullyQualifiedName(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor) {
451    return descriptor.getFullName();
452  }
453
454  /**
455   * Resolve the fully-qualified type path, or name, for the provided datamodel instance. This method is essentially
456   * syntactic sugar for accessing the model instance's descriptor, and then grabbing the fully-qualified name.
457   *
458   * @param model Model instance to resolve a fully-qualified name for.
459   * @return Fully-qualified model type name.
460   */
461  public static @Nonnull String fullyQualifiedName(@Nonnull Message model) {
462    return fullyQualifiedName(model.getDescriptorForType());
463  }
464
465  // -- Metadata: Role Annotations -- //
466
467  /**
468   * Resolve the general type for a given datamodel type descriptor. The type is either set by default, or set by an
469   * explicit annotation affixed to the protocol buffer definition that backs the model.
470   *
471   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
472   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you.</p>
473   *
474   * @param descriptor Model descriptor to retrieve a type for.
475   * @return Type of the provided datamodel.
476   */
477  public static @Nonnull DatapointType role(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor) {
478    var ext = modelAnnotation(descriptor, Datamodel.role, false);
479    if (ext.isPresent())
480      return ext.get();
481    return DatapointType.OBJECT;
482  }
483
484  /**
485   * Resolve the general type for a given datamodel. The type is either set by default, or set by an explicit annotation
486   * affixed to the protocol buffer definition that backs the model.
487   *
488   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
489   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you.</p>
490   *
491   * @param model Model to retrieve a type for.
492   * @return Type of the provided datamodel.
493   */
494  public static @Nonnull DatapointType role(@Nonnull Message model) {
495    Objects.requireNonNull(model, "Cannot resolve type for `null` model.");
496    return role(model.getDescriptorForType());
497  }
498
499  /**
500   * Enforce that a particular datamodel type matches <b>any</b> of the provided {@link DatapointType} annotations.
501   *
502   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
503   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
504   * a set of types for you.</p>
505   *
506   * @param model Model to validate against the provided set of types.
507   * @param type Type to enforce for the provided model.
508   * @return Whether the provided model is a <i>member-of</i> (annotated-by) any of the provided {@code types}.
509   */
510  public static boolean matchRole(@Nonnull Message model, @Nonnull DatapointType type) {
511    Objects.requireNonNull(type, "Cannot match `null` model type.");
512    return type.equals(role(model));
513  }
514
515  /**
516   * Enforce that a particular datamodel schema {@code descriptor} matches <b>any</b> of the provided
517   * {@link DatapointType} annotations.
518   *
519   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
520   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
521   * a set of types for you.</p>
522   *
523   * @param descriptor Schema descriptor to validate against the provided set of types.
524   * @param type Type to enforce for the provided model.
525   * @return Whether the provided model is a <i>member-of</i> (annotated-by) any of the provided {@code types}.
526   */
527  public static boolean matchRole(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor, @Nonnull DatapointType type) {
528    Objects.requireNonNull(type, "Cannot match `null` descriptor type.");
529    return type.equals(role(descriptor));
530  }
531
532  /**
533   * <b>Check</b> that a particular datamodel type matches <b>any</b> of the provided {@link DatapointType} annotations.
534   *
535   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
536   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
537   * a set of types for you.</p>
538   *
539   * @param model Model to validate against the provided set of types.
540   * @param types Types to validate the model against. If <b>any</b> of the provided types match, the check passes.
541   * @return Whether the provided model is a <i>member-of</i> (annotated-by) any of the provided {@code types}.
542   */
543  public static boolean matchAnyRole(@Nonnull Message model, @Nonnull DatapointType ...types) {
544    Objects.requireNonNull(types, "Cannot match `null` model types.");
545    return EnumSet.copyOf(Arrays.asList(types)).contains(role(model));
546  }
547
548  /**
549   * <b>Check</b> that a particular schema {@code descriptor} matches <b>any</b> of the provided {@link DatapointType}
550   * annotations.
551   *
552   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
553   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
554   * a set of types for you.</p>
555   *
556   * @param descriptor Schema descriptor to validate against the provided set of types.
557   * @param types Types to validate the model against. If <b>any</b> of the provided types match, the check passes.
558   * @return Whether the provided model is a <i>member-of</i> (annotated-by) any of the provided {@code types}.
559   */
560  public static boolean matchAnyRole(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor, @Nonnull DatapointType ...types) {
561    Objects.requireNonNull(types, "Cannot match `null` model types.");
562    return EnumSet.copyOf(Arrays.asList(types)).contains(role(descriptor));
563  }
564
565  /**
566   * <b>Enforce</b> that a particular {@code model} instance matches the provided {@link DatapointType} annotation.
567   *
568   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
569   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
570   * a set of types for you.</p>
571   *
572   * @param model Model to validate against the provided set of types.
573   * @param type Types to validate the model against. If <b>any</b> of the provided types match, the check passes.
574   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model's type is not included in {@code types}.
575   */
576  public static void enforceRole(@Nonnull Message model, @Nonnull DatapointType type) throws InvalidModelType {
577    if (!matchRole(model, type)) throw InvalidModelType.from(model, EnumSet.of(type));
578  }
579
580  /**
581   * <b>Enforce</b> that a particular datamodel schema {@code descriptor} matches the provided {@link DatapointType}
582   * annotation.
583   *
584   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
585   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
586   * a set of types for you.</p>
587   *
588   * @param descriptor Descriptor to validate against the provided set of types.
589   * @param type Types to validate the model against. If <b>any</b> of the provided types match, the check passes.
590   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model's type is not included in {@code types}.
591   */
592  public static void enforceRole(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor, @Nonnull DatapointType type) throws InvalidModelType {
593    if (!matchRole(descriptor, type)) throw InvalidModelType.from(descriptor, EnumSet.of(type));
594  }
595
596  /**
597   * <b>Enforce</b> that a particular datamodel type matches <b>any</b> of the provided {@link DatapointType}
598   * annotations.
599   *
600   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
601   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
602   * a set of types for you.</p>
603   *
604   * @param model Model to validate against the provided set of types.
605   * @param types Types to validate the model against. If <b>any</b> of the provided types match, the check passes.
606   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model's type is not included in {@code types}.
607   */
608  public static void enforceAnyRole(@Nonnull Message model, @Nonnull DatapointType ...types) throws InvalidModelType {
609    if (!matchAnyRole(model, types)) throw InvalidModelType.from(model, EnumSet.copyOf(Arrays.asList(types)));
610  }
611
612  /**
613   * <b>Enforce</b> that a particular schema {@code descriptor} matches <b>any</b> of the provided {@link DatapointType}
614   * annotations.
615   *
616   * <p>{@link DatapointType} annotations describe the general use case for a given model definition. Is it a database
617   * model? A wire model? {@link DatapointType} will tell you, and this model will sweetly enforce membership amongst
618   * a set of types for you.</p>
619   *
620   * @param descriptor Schema descriptor to validate against the provided set of types.
621   * @param types Types to validate the model against. If <b>any</b> of the provided types match, the check passes.
622   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model's type is not included in {@code types}.
623   */
624  public static void enforceAnyRole(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
625                                    @Nonnull DatapointType ...types) throws InvalidModelType {
626    if (!matchAnyRole(descriptor, types)) throw InvalidModelType.from(descriptor, EnumSet.copyOf(Arrays.asList(types)));
627  }
628
629  // -- Metadata: Field Resolution -- //
630
631  /**
632   * Resolve an arbitrary field pointer from the provided model {@code instance}, specified by the given {@code path} to
633   * the property. If the property cannot be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned.
634   *
635   * <p>This method is <b>safe</b>, in that, unlike other util methods for model metadata, it will not throw if the
636   * provided {@code path} is invalid.</p>
637   *
638   * @param instance Model instance on which to resolve the specified field.
639   * @param path Dotted deep-path to the desired field.
640   * @return Resolved field pointer for the requested field, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
641   */
642  public static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> resolveField(@Nonnull Message instance, @Nonnull String path) {
643    return resolveField(instance.getDescriptorForType(), path);
644  }
645
646  /**
647   * Resolve an arbitrary field pointer from the provided model type {@code escriptor}, specified by the given
648   * {@code path} to the property. If the property cannot be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned.
649   *
650   * <p>This method is <b>safe</b>, in that, unlike other util methods for model metadata, it will not throw if the
651   * provided {@code path} is invalid.</p>
652   *
653   * @param descriptor Model type descriptor on which to resolve the specified field.
654   * @param path Dotted deep-path to the desired field.
655   * @return Resolved field pointer for the requested field, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
656   */
657  public static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> resolveField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor, @Nonnull String path) {
658    return resolveArbitraryField(descriptor, descriptor, path, path);
659  }
660
661  // -- Metadata: Model Annotations -- //
662
663  /**
664   * Retrieve a model-level annotation, from {@code instance}, structured by {@code ext}. If no instance of the
665   * requested model annotation can be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. Search recursively is supported as
666   * well, which descends the search to sub-messages to search for the desired annotation.
667   *
668   * @param instance Message instance to scan for the specified annotation.
669   * @param ext Extension to fetch from the subject model, or any sub-model (if {@code recursive} is {@code true}).
670   * @param recursive Whether to search recursively for the desired extension.
671   * @param <E> Generic type of extension we are looking for.
672   * @return Optional, either {@link Optional#empty()}, or wrapping the found extension data instance.
673   */
674  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<E> modelAnnotation(@Nonnull Message instance,
675                                                         @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<MessageOptions, E> ext,
676                                                         @Nonnull Boolean recursive) {
677    return modelAnnotation(instance.getDescriptorForType(), ext, recursive);
678  }
679
680  /**
681   * Retrieve a model-level annotation, from the provided model schema {@code descriptor}, structured by {@code ext}. If
682   * no instance of the requested model annotation can be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. Search
683   * recursively is supported as well, which descends the search to sub-messages to search for the desired annotation.
684   *
685   * @param descriptor Schema descriptor for a model type.
686   * @param ext Extension to fetch from the subject model, or any sub-model (if {@code recursive} is {@code true}).
687   * @param recursive Whether to search recursively for the desired extension.
688   * @param <E> Generic type of extension we are looking for.
689   * @return Optional, either {@link Optional#empty()}, or wrapping the found extension data instance.
690   */
691  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<E> modelAnnotation(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
692                                                         @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<MessageOptions, E> ext,
693                                                         @Nonnull Boolean recursive) {
694    Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor, "Cannot resolve type for `null` descriptor.");
695    if (descriptor.getOptions().hasExtension(ext))
696      return Optional.of(descriptor.getOptions().getExtension(ext));
697    if (recursive) {
698      // loop through fields. gather any sub-messages, and check procedurally if any of them match. if we find one that
699      // does, we return immediately.
700      for (FieldDescriptor field : descriptor.getFields()) {
701        if (field.getType() == FieldDescriptor.Type.MESSAGE) {
702          //noinspection ConstantConditions
703          var subresult = modelAnnotation(field.getMessageType(), ext, recursive);
704          if (subresult.isPresent())
705            return subresult;
706        }
707      }
708    }
709    return Optional.empty();
710  }
711
712  // -- Metadata: Field Annotations -- //
713
714  /**
715   * Resolve a {@link FieldPointer} within the scope of {@code instance}, that holds values for the specified metadata
716   * annotation {@code ext}. By default, this method searches recursively.
717   *
718   * @see #annotatedField(Descriptor, GeneratedExtension) variant if a descriptor is on-hand
719   * @see #annotatedField(Descriptor, GeneratedExtension, Boolean, Optional) full-spec variant.
720   * @param instance Model instance to search for the specified annotated field on.
721   * @param ext Extension (annotation) which should be affixed to the field we are searching for.
722   * @param <E> Extension generic type.
723   * @return Optional-wrapped field pointer, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
724   */
725  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> annotatedField(@Nonnull Message instance,
726                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext) {
727    return annotatedField(instance, ext, true);
728  }
729
730  /**
731   * Resolve a {@link FieldPointer} within the scope of {@code instance}, that holds values for the specified metadata
732   * annotation {@code ext}.
733   *
734   * <p>This method variant also allows specifying a <b>recursive</b> flag, which, if specified, causes the search to
735   * proceed to sub-models (recursively) until a matching field is found. If <b>recursive</b> is passed as {@code false}
736   * then the search will only occur at the top-level of {@code instance}.</p>
737   *
738   * @see #annotatedField(Message, GeneratedExtension, Boolean, Optional) Variant that supports a filter
739   * @see #annotatedField(Descriptor, GeneratedExtension, Boolean, Optional) full-spec variant.
740   * @param instance Model instance to search for the specified annotated field on.
741   * @param ext Extension (annotation) which should be affixed to the field we are searching for.
742   * @param recursive Whether to conduct this search recursively, or just at the top-level.
743   * @param <E> Extension generic type.
744   * @return Optional-wrapped field pointer, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
745   */
746  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> annotatedField(@Nonnull Message instance,
747                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext,
748                                                                   @Nonnull Boolean recursive) {
749    return annotatedField(instance, ext, recursive, Optional.empty());
750  }
751
752  /**
753   * Resolve a {@link FieldPointer} within the scope of {@code instance}, that holds values for the specified metadata
754   * annotation {@code ext}.
755   *
756   * <p>This method variant also allows specifying a <b>filter</b>, which will be run for each property encountered with
757   * the annotation present. If the filter returns {@code true}, the field will be selected, otherwise, the search
758   * continues until all properties are exhausted (depending on {@code recursive}).</p>
759   *
760   * @param instance Model instance to search for the specified annotated field on.
761   * @param ext Extension (annotation) which should be affixed to the field we are searching for.
762   * @param recursive Whether to conduct this search recursively, or just at the top-level.
763   * @param <E> Extension generic type.
764   * @return Optional-wrapped field pointer, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
765   */
766  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> annotatedField(@Nonnull Message instance,
767                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext,
768                                                                   @Nonnull Boolean recursive,
769                                                                   @Nonnull Optional<Function<E, Boolean>> filter) {
770    return annotatedField(instance.getDescriptorForType(), ext, recursive, filter);
771  }
772
773  /**
774   * Resolve a {@link FieldPointer} within the scope of the provided model {@code descriptor}, that holds values for the
775   * specified metadata annotation {@code ext}. By default, this search occurs recursively, examining all nested sub-
776   * models on the provided instance.
777   *
778   * @param descriptor Model object descriptor to search for the specified annotated field on.
779   * @param ext Extension (annotation) which should be affixed to the field we are searching for.
780   * @param <E> Extension generic type.
781   * @return Optional-wrapped field pointer, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
782   */
783  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> annotatedField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
784                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext) {
785    return annotatedField(descriptor, ext, Optional.empty());
786  }
787
788  /**
789   * Resolve a {@link FieldPointer} within the scope of the provided model {@code descriptor}, that holds values for the
790   * specified metadata annotation {@code ext}. By default, this search occurs recursively, examining all nested sub-
791   * models on the provided instance.
792   *
793   * <p>This method variant also allows specifying a <b>filter</b>, which will be run for each property encountered with
794   * the annotation present. If the filter returns {@code true}, the field will be selected, otherwise, the search
795   * continues until all properties are exhausted (depending on {@code recursive}).</p>
796   *
797   * @param descriptor Model object descriptor to search for the specified annotated field on.
798   * @param ext Extension (annotation) which should be affixed to the field we are searching for.
799   * @param <E> Extension generic type.
800   * @return Optional-wrapped field pointer, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
801   */
802  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> annotatedField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
803                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext,
804                                                                   @Nonnull Optional<Function<E, Boolean>> filter) {
805    return annotatedField(descriptor, ext, true, filter);
806  }
807
808  /**
809   * Resolve a {@link FieldPointer} within the scope of the provided model {@code descriptor}, that holds values for the
810   * specified metadata annotation {@code ext}. Using the {@code recursive} parameter, the invoking developer may opt to
811   * search for the annotated field recursively.
812   *
813   * <p>This method variant also allows specifying a <b>filter</b>, which will be run for each property encountered with
814   * the annotation present. If the filter returns {@code true}, the field will be selected, otherwise, the search
815   * continues until all properties are exhausted (depending on {@code recursive}).</p>
816   *
817   * @param descriptor Model object descriptor to search for the specified annotated field on.
818   * @param ext Extension (annotation) which should be affixed to the field we are searching for.
819   * @param <E> Extension generic type.
820   * @return Optional-wrapped field pointer, or {@link Optional#empty()}.
821   */
822  public static @Nonnull <E> Optional<FieldPointer> annotatedField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor,
823                                                                   @Nonnull GeneratedExtension<FieldOptions, E> ext,
824                                                                   @Nonnull Boolean recursive,
825                                                                   @Nonnull Optional<Function<E, Boolean>> filter) {
826    return resolveAnnotatedField(descriptor, ext, recursive, filter, "");
827  }
828
829  // -- Metadata: ID Fields -- //
830
831  /**
832   * Resolve a pointer to the provided model {@code instance}'s ID field, whether or not it has a value. If there is no
833   * ID-annotated field at all, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. Alternatively, if the model is not compatible with
834   * ID fields, an exception is raised (see below).
835   *
836   * @param instance Model instance for which an ID field is being resolved.
837   * @return Optional, either {@link Optional#empty()} or containing a {@link FieldPointer} to the resolved ID field.
838   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model does not support IDs. Only objects of type {@code OBJECT} can be
839   *         used with this interface.
840   */
841  public static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> idField(@Nonnull Message instance) throws InvalidModelType {
842    return idField(instance.getDescriptorForType());
843  }
844
845  /**
846   * Resolve a pointer to the provided schema type {@code descriptor}'s ID field, whether or not it has a value. If
847   * there is no ID-annotated field at all, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. Alternatively, if the model is not
848   * compatible with ID fields, an exception is raised (see below).
849   *
850   * @param descriptor Model instance for which an ID field is being resolved.
851   * @return Optional, either {@link Optional#empty()} or containing a {@link FieldPointer} to the resolved ID field.
852   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model does not support IDs. Only objects of type {@code OBJECT} can be
853   *         used with this interface.
854   */
855  public static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> idField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor) throws InvalidModelType {
856    enforceAnyRole(Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor), DatapointType.OBJECT, DatapointType.OBJECT_KEY);
857    var topLevelId = Objects.requireNonNull(annotatedField(
858      descriptor,
859      Datamodel.field,
860      false,
861      Optional.of((field) -> field.getType() == FieldType.ID)));
862
863    if (topLevelId.isPresent()) {
864      return topLevelId;
865    } else {
866      // okay. no top level ID. what about keys, which must be top-level?
867      var keyBase = keyField(descriptor);
868      if (keyBase.isPresent()) {
869        // we found a key, so scan the key for an ID, which is required on keys.
870        return Objects.requireNonNull(resolveAnnotatedField(
871          keyBase.get().field.getMessageType(),
872          Datamodel.field,
873          false,
874          Optional.of((field) -> field.getType() == FieldType.ID),
875          keyBase.get().getField().getName()));
876      }
877    }
878    // there's no top-level ID, and no top-level key, or the key had no ID. we're done here.
879    return Optional.empty();
880  }
881
882  // -- Metadata: Key Fields -- //
883
884  /**
885   * Resolve a pointer to the provided schema type {@code descriptor}'s {@code KEY} field, whether or not it has a value
886   * assigned. If there is no key-annotated field at all, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. Alternatively, if the
887   * model is not compatible with key fields, an exception is raised (see below).
888   *
889   * @param instance Model instance for which a key field is being resolved.
890   * @return Optional, either {@link Optional#empty()} or containing a {@link FieldPointer} to the resolved key field.
891   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model does not support keys. Only objects of type {@code OBJECT} can be
892   *         used with this interface.
893   */
894  public static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> keyField(@Nonnull Message instance) throws InvalidModelType {
895    return keyField(instance.getDescriptorForType());
896  }
897
898  /**
899   * Resolve a pointer to the provided schema type {@code descriptor}'s {@code KEY} field, whether or not it has a value
900   * assigned. If there is no key-annotated field at all, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. Alternatively, if the
901   * model is not compatible with key fields, an exception is raised (see below).
902   *
903   * @param descriptor Model type descriptor for which a key field is being resolved.
904   * @return Optional, either {@link Optional#empty()} or containing a {@link FieldPointer} to the resolved key field.
905   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model does not support keys. Only objects of type {@code OBJECT} can be
906   *         used with this interface.
907   */
908  public static @Nonnull Optional<FieldPointer> keyField(@Nonnull Descriptor descriptor) throws InvalidModelType {
909    enforceAnyRole(Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor), DatapointType.OBJECT);
910    return Objects.requireNonNull(annotatedField(
911      Objects.requireNonNull(descriptor),
912      Datamodel.field,
913      false,
914      Optional.of((field) -> field.getType() == FieldType.KEY)));
915  }
916
917  // -- Metadata: Value Pluck -- //
918
919  /**
920   * Pluck a field value, addressed by a {@link FieldPointer}, from the provided {@code instance}. If the referenced
921   * field is a message, a message instance will be handed back only if there is an initialized value. Leaf fields
922   * return their raw value, if set. In all cases, if there is no initialized value, {@link Optional#empty()} is
923   * returned.
924   *
925   * @param instance Model instance from which to pluck the property.
926   * @param fieldPointer Pointer to the field we wish to fetch.
927   * @param <V> Generic type of data returned by this operation.
928   * @return Optional wrapping the resolved value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if no value could be resolved.
929   * @throws IllegalStateException If the referenced property is not found, despite witnessing matching types.
930   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the specified field does not have a matching base type with {@code instance}.
931   */
932  public static @Nonnull <V> FieldContainer<V> pluck(@Nonnull Message instance, @Nonnull FieldPointer fieldPointer) {
933    return pluck(instance, fieldPointer.path);
934  }
935
936  /**
937   * Return a single field value container, plucked from the specified deep {@code path}, in dot form, using the regular
938   * protobuf-definition names for each field. If a referenced field is a message, a message instance will be returned
939   * only if there is an initialized value. Leaf fields return their raw value, if set. In all cases, if there is no
940   * initialized value, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in place.
941   *
942   * @param instance Model instance to pluck the specified property from.
943   * @param path Deep path for the property value we wish to pluck.
944   * @param <V> Expected type for the property. If types do not match, a {@link ClassCastException} will be raised.
945   * @return Field container, either empty, or containing the plucked value.
946   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the provided path is syntactically invalid, or the field does not exist.
947   */
948  public static @Nonnull <V> FieldContainer<V> pluck(@Nonnull Message instance, @Nonnull String path) {
949    return pluckFieldRecursive(instance, instance, path, path);
950  }
951
952  /**
953   * Return an iterable containing plucked value containers for each field mentioned in {@code mask}, that is present on
954   * {@code instance} with an initialized value. If a referenced field is a message, a message instance will be included
955   * only if there is an initialized value. Leaf fields return their raw value, if set. In all cases, if there is no
956   * initialized value, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in place.
957   *
958   * <p>If a field cannot be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in its place, so that the output order matches
959   * path iteration order on the supplied {@code mask}. This method is therefore safe with regard to path access.</p>
960   *
961   * @param instance Model instance to pluck the specified properties from.
962   * @param mask Mask of properties to pluck from the model instance.
963   * @return Stream which emits each field container, with a generic {@code Object} for each value.
964   */
965  public static @Nonnull SortedSet<FieldContainer<Object>> pluckAll(@Nonnull Message instance, @Nonnull FieldMask mask) {
966    return pluckAll(instance, mask, true);
967  }
968
969  /**
970   * Return an iterable containing plucked value containers for each field mentioned in {@code mask}, that is present on
971   * {@code instance} with an initialized value. If a referenced field is a message, a message instance will be included
972   * only if there is an initialized value. Leaf fields return their raw value, if set. In all cases, if there is no
973   * initialized value, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in place.
974   *
975   * <p>If a field cannot be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in its place, so that the output order matches
976   * path iteration order on the supplied {@code mask}. This method is therefore safe with regard to path access. If
977   * {@code normalize} is activated (the default for {@link #pluckAll(Message, FieldMask)}), the field mask will be
978   * sorted and de-duplicated before processing.</p>
979   *
980   * <p>Sort order of the return value is based on the full path of properties selected - i.e. field containers are
981   * returned in lexicographic sort order matching their underlying property paths.</p>
982   *
983   * @param instance Model instance to pluck the specified properties from.
984   * @param mask Mask of properties to pluck from the model instance.
985   * @param normalize Whether to normalize the field mask before plucking fields.
986   * @return Stream which emits each field container, with a generic {@code Object} for each value.
987   */
988  public static @Nonnull SortedSet<FieldContainer<Object>> pluckAll(@Nonnull Message instance,
989                                                                    @Nonnull FieldMask mask,
990                                                                    @Nonnull Boolean normalize) {
991    return ImmutableSortedSet.copyOfSorted(pluckStream(instance, mask, normalize)
992      .collect(Collectors.toCollection(ConcurrentSkipListSet::new)));
993  }
994
995  /**
996   * Return a stream which emits plucked value containers for each field mentioned in {@code mask}, that is present on
997   * {@code instance} with an initialized value. If a referenced field is a message, a message instance will be emitted
998   * only if there is an initialized value. Leaf fields return their raw value, if set. In all cases, if there is no
999   * initialized value, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in place.
1000   *
1001   * <p>If a field cannot be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in its place, so that the output order matches
1002   * path iteration order on the supplied {@code mask}. This method is therefore safe with regard to path access.</p>
1003   *
1004   * <p><b>Performance note:</b> the {@link Stream} returned by this method is explicitly parallel-capable, because
1005   * reading descriptor schema is safely concurrent.</p>
1006   *
1007   * @param instance Model instance to pluck the specified properties from.
1008   * @param mask Mask of properties to pluck from the model instance.
1009   * @return Stream which emits each field container, with a generic {@code Object} for each value.
1010   */
1011  public static @Nonnull Stream<FieldContainer<Object>> pluckStream(@Nonnull Message instance,
1012                                                                    @Nonnull FieldMask mask) {
1013    return pluckStream(instance, mask, true);
1014  }
1015
1016  /**
1017   * Return a stream which emits plucked value containers for each field mentioned in {@code mask}, that is present on
1018   * {@code instance} with an initialized value. If a referenced field is a message, a message instance will be emitted
1019   * only if there is an initialized value. Leaf fields return their raw value, if set. In all cases, if there is no
1020   * initialized value, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in place.
1021   *
1022   * <p>If a field cannot be found, {@link Optional#empty()} is supplied in its place, so that the output order matches
1023   * path iteration order on the supplied {@code mask}. This method is therefore safe with regard to path access. If
1024   * {@code normalize} is activated (the default for {@link #pluckStream(Message, FieldMask)}), the field mask will be
1025   * sorted and de-duplicated before processing.</p>
1026   *
1027   * <p><b>Performance note:</b> the {@link Stream} returned by this method is explicitly parallel-capable, because
1028   * reading descriptor schema is safely concurrent.</p>
1029   *
1030   * @param instance Model instance to pluck the specified properties from.
1031   * @param mask Mask of properties to pluck from the model instance.
1032   * @param normalize Whether to normalize the field mask before plucking fields.
1033   * @return Stream which emits each field container, with a generic {@code Object} for each value.
1034   */
1035  public static @Nonnull Stream<FieldContainer<Object>> pluckStream(@Nonnull Message instance,
1036                                                                    @Nonnull FieldMask mask,
1037                                                                    @Nonnull Boolean normalize) {
1038    return (new TreeSet<>((normalize ? FieldMaskUtil.normalize(mask) : mask).getPathsList()))
1039      .parallelStream()
1040      .map((fieldPath) -> pluck(instance, fieldPath));
1041  }
1042
1043  // -- Metadata: ID/Key Value Pluck -- //
1044
1045  /**
1046   * Resolve the provided model instance's assigned ID, by walking the property structure for the entity, and returning
1047   * either the first {@code id}-annotated field's value at the top-level, or the first {@code id}-annotated field value
1048   * on the first {@code key}-annotated message field at the top level of the provided message.
1049   *
1050   * <p>If no ID field <i>value</i> can be resolved, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. On the other hand, if the
1051   * model is not a business object or does not have an ID annotation at all, an exception is raised (see below).</p>
1052   *
1053   * @param <ID> Type for the ID value we are resolving.
1054   * @param instance Model instance for which an ID value is desired.
1055   * @return Optional wrapping the value of the model instance's ID, or an empty optional if no value could be resolved.
1056   * @throws InvalidModelType If the supplied model is not a business object and/or does not have an ID field at all.
1057   */
1058  public static @Nonnull <ID> Optional<ID> id(@Nonnull Message instance) {
1059    var descriptor = instance.getDescriptorForType();
1060    enforceAnyRole(descriptor, DatapointType.OBJECT, DatapointType.OBJECT_KEY);
1061    Optional<FieldPointer> idField = idField(descriptor);
1062    if (!idField.isPresent())
1063      throw new MissingAnnotatedField(descriptor, FieldType.ID);
1064    return ModelMetadata.<ID>pluck(instance, idField.get()).getValue();
1065  }
1066
1067  /**
1068   * Resolve the provided model instance's assigned {@code KEY} instance, by walking the property structure for the
1069   * entity, and returning the first {@code key}-annotated field's value at the top-level of the provided message.
1070   *
1071   * <p>If no key field <i>value</i> can be resolved, {@link Optional#empty()} is returned. On the other hand, if the
1072   * model is not a business object or does not support key annotations at all, an exception is raised (see below).</p>
1073   *
1074   * @param <Key> Type for the key we are resolving.
1075   * @param instance Model instance for which an key value is desired.
1076   * @return Optional wrapping the value of the model instance's key, or an empty optional if none could be resolved.
1077   * @throws InvalidModelType If the supplied model is not a business object and/or does not have an key field at all.
1078   */
1079  public static @Nonnull <Key> Optional<Key> key(@Nonnull Message instance) {
1080    Descriptor descriptor = instance.getDescriptorForType();
1081    enforceRole(descriptor, DatapointType.OBJECT);
1082    Optional<FieldPointer> keyField = annotatedField(
1083      descriptor,
1084      Datamodel.field,
1085      false,
1086      Optional.of((field) -> field.getType() == FieldType.KEY));
1087
1088    if (!keyField.isPresent())
1089      throw new MissingAnnotatedField(descriptor, FieldType.KEY);
1090    //noinspection unchecked
1091    return (Optional<Key>)pluck(instance, keyField.get()).getValue();
1092  }
1093
1094  // -- Metadata: Value Splice -- //
1095
1096  /**
1097   * Splice the provided optional value (or clear any existing value) at the field {@code path} in the provided model
1098   * {@code instance}. Return a re-built message after the splice.
1099   *
1100   * <p>If {@link Optional#empty()} is passed for the {@code value} to set, any existing value placed in that field
1101   * will be cleared. This method works identically for primitive leaf fields and message fields.</p>
1102   *
1103   * @param instance Model instance to splice the value into.
1104   * @param path Deep path at which to splice the value.
1105   * @param val Value to splice into the model, or {@link Optional#empty()} to clear any existing value.
1106   * @param <Model> Model type which we are working with for this splice operation.
1107   * @param <Value> Value type which we are splicing in, if applicable.
1108   * @return Re-built model, after the splice operation.
1109   */
1110  public static @Nonnull <Model extends Message, Value> Model splice(@Nonnull Message instance,
1111                                                                     @Nonnull String path,
1112                                                                     @Nonnull Optional<Value> val) {
1113
1114    return splice(
1115      instance,
1116      resolveField(instance, path)
1117        .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
1118          "Failed to resolve path '%s' on model instance of type '%s' for value splice.",
1119          path,
1120          instance.getDescriptorForType().getName()))),
1121      val);
1122  }
1123
1124  /**
1125   * Splice the provided optional value (or clear any existing value) at the specified {@code field} pointer, in the
1126   * provided model {@code instance}. Return a re-built message after the splice.
1127   *
1128   * <p>If {@link Optional#empty()} is passed for the {@code value} to set, any existing value placed in that field
1129   * will be cleared. This method works identically for primitive leaf fields and message fields.</p>
1130   *
1131   * @param instance Model instance to splice the value into.
1132   * @param field Resolved and validated field pointer for the field to splice.
1133   * @param val Value to splice into the model, or {@link Optional#empty()} to clear any existing value.
1134   * @param <Model> Model type which we are working with for this splice operation.
1135   * @param <Value> Value type which we are splicing in, if applicable.
1136   * @return Re-built model, after the splice operation.
1137   */
1138  public static @Nonnull <Model extends Message, Value> Model splice(@Nonnull Message instance,
1139                                                                     @Nonnull FieldPointer field,
1140                                                                     @Nonnull Optional<Value> val) {
1141    //noinspection unchecked
1142    return (Model)spliceBuilder(instance.toBuilder(), field, val).build();
1143  }
1144
1145  /**
1146   * Splice the provided optional value (or clear any existing value) at the specified {@code field} pointer, in the
1147   * provided model {@code instance}. Return the provided builder after the splice operation. The return value may be
1148   * ignored if the developer so wishes (the provided {@code builder} is mutated in place).
1149   *
1150   * <p>If {@link Optional#empty()} is passed for the {@code value} to set, any existing value placed in that field
1151   * will be cleared. This method works identically for primitive leaf fields and message fields.</p>
1152   *
1153   * @param builder Model builder to splice the value into.
1154   * @param field Resolved and validated field pointer for the field to splice.
1155   * @param val Value to splice into the model, or {@link Optional#empty()} to clear any existing value.
1156   * @param <Builder> Model builder type which we are working with for this splice operation.
1157   * @param <Value> Value type which we are splicing in, if applicable.
1158   * @return Model {@code builder}, after the splice operation.
1159   */
1160  @CanIgnoreReturnValue
1161  public static @Nonnull <Builder extends Message.Builder, Value> Builder spliceBuilder(
1162    @Nonnull Message.Builder builder,
1163    @Nonnull FieldPointer field,
1164    @Nonnull Optional<Value> val) {
1165    return spliceArbitraryField(
1166      builder,
1167      builder,
1168      field.path,
1169      val,
1170      field.path);
1171  }
1172
1173  // -- Metadata: ID/Key Splice -- //
1174
1175  /**
1176   * Splice the provided value at {@code val}, into the ID field value for {@code instance}. If an ID-annotated property
1177   * cannot be located, or the model is not of a suitable/type role for use with IDs, an exception is raised (see below
1178   * for more info).
1179   *
1180   * <p>If an existing value exists for the model's ID, <b>it will be replaced</b>. In most object-based storage engines
1181   * this will end up copying the object, rather than mutating an ID. Be careful of this behavior. Passing
1182   * {@link Optional#empty()} will clear any existing ID on the model.</p>
1183   *
1184   * @param instance Model instance to splice the value into. Because models are immutable, this involves converting the
1185   *                 model to a builder, splicing in the value, and then re-building the model. As such, the model
1186   *                 returned will be a <i>different object instance</i>, but will otherwise be untouched.
1187   * @param val Value we should splice-into the ID field for the record. It is expected that the generic type of this
1188   *            value will line up with the ID field type, otherwise a {@link ClassCastException} will be thrown.
1189   * @param <Model> Type of model we are splicing an ID value into.
1190   * @param <Value> Type of ID value we are splicing into the model.
1191   * @return Model instance, rebuilt, after splicing in the provided value, at the model's ID-annotated field.
1192   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model is not suitable for use with IDs at all.
1193   * @throws ClassCastException If the {@code Value} generic type does not match the ID field primitive type.
1194   * @throws MissingAnnotatedField If the provided {@code instance} is not of the correct type, or has no ID field.
1195   */
1196  public static @Nonnull <Model extends Message, Value> Model spliceId(@Nonnull Message instance,
1197                                                                       @Nonnull Optional<Value> val) {
1198    //noinspection unchecked
1199    return (Model)spliceIdBuilder(instance.toBuilder(), val).build();
1200  }
1201
1202  /**
1203   * Splice the provided value at {@code val}, into the ID field value for the provided model {@code builder}. If an ID-
1204   * annotated property cannot be located, or the model is not of a suitable/type role for use with IDs, an exception is
1205   * raised (see below for more info).
1206   *
1207   * <p>If an existing value exists for the model's ID, <b>it will be replaced</b>. In most object-based storage engines
1208   * this will end up copying the object, rather than mutating an ID. Be careful of this behavior. Passing
1209   * {@link Optional#empty()} will clear any existing ID on the model.</p>
1210   *
1211   * @param builder Model instance builder to splice the value into. The builder provided is <i>mutated in place</i>, so
1212   *                it will be an identical object instance to the one provided, but with the ID property filled in.
1213   * @param val Value we should splice-into the ID field for the record. It is expected that the generic type of this
1214   *            value will line up with the ID field type, otherwise a {@link ClassCastException} will be thrown.
1215   * @param <Builder> Type of model builder we are splicing an ID value into.
1216   * @param <Value> Type of ID value we are splicing into the model.
1217   * @return Model builder, after splicing in the provided value, at the model's ID-annotated field.
1218   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model is not suitable for use with IDs at all.
1219   * @throws ClassCastException If the {@code Value} generic type does not match the ID field primitive type.
1220   * @throws MissingAnnotatedField If the provided {@code builder} is not of the correct type, or has no ID field.
1221   */
1222  public static @Nonnull <Builder extends Message.Builder, Value> Builder spliceIdBuilder(
1223    @Nonnull Message.Builder builder,
1224    @Nonnull Optional<Value> val) {
1225    // resolve descriptor and field
1226    if (val.isPresent() && val.get() instanceof Message)
1227      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot set messages as ID values.");
1228    var descriptor = builder.getDescriptorForType();
1229    enforceAnyRole(descriptor, DatapointType.OBJECT, DatapointType.OBJECT_KEY);
1230    var fieldPath = idField(descriptor)
1231      .orElseThrow(() -> new MissingAnnotatedField(descriptor, FieldType.ID))
1232      .getPath();
1233
1234    return spliceArbitraryField(
1235      builder,
1236      builder,
1237      fieldPath,
1238      val,
1239      fieldPath);
1240  }
1241
1242  /**
1243   * Splice the provided value at {@code val}, into the key message value for {@code instance}. If a key-annotated
1244   * property cannot be located, or the model is not of a suitable/type role for use with keys, an exception is raised
1245   * (see below for more info).
1246   *
1247   * <p>If an existing value is set for the model's key, <b>it will be replaced</b>. In most object-based storage
1248   * engines this will end up copying the object, rather than mutating a key. Keys are usually immutable for this
1249   * reason, so use this method with care. Passing {@link Optional#empty()} will clear any existing key message
1250   * currently affixed to the model {@code instance}.</p>
1251   *
1252   * @param instance Model instance to splice the value into. Because models are immutable, this involves converting the
1253   *                 model to a builder, splicing in the value, and then re-building the model. As such, the model
1254   *                 returned will be a <i>different object instance</i>, but will otherwise be untouched.
1255   * @param val Value we should splice-into the ID field for the record. It is expected that the generic type of this
1256   *            value will line up with the ID field type, otherwise a {@link ClassCastException} will be thrown.
1257   * @param <Model> Type of model we are splicing an ID value into.
1258   * @param <Key> Type of key message we are splicing into the model.
1259   * @return Model instance, rebuilt, after splicing in the provided value, at the model's ID-annotated field.
1260   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model is not suitable for use with IDs at all.
1261   * @throws ClassCastException If the {@code Value} generic type does not match the ID field primitive type.
1262   * @throws MissingAnnotatedField If the provided {@code builder} is not of the correct type, or has no ID field.
1263   */
1264  public static @Nonnull <Model extends Message, Key extends Message> Model spliceKey(@Nonnull Message instance,
1265                                                                                      @Nonnull Optional<Key> val) {
1266    //noinspection unchecked
1267    return (Model)spliceKeyBuilder(instance.toBuilder(), val).build();
1268  }
1269
1270  /**
1271   * Splice the provided value at {@code val}, into the key message value for the supplied {@code builder}. If a
1272   * key-annotated property cannot be located, or the model is not of a suitable/type role for use with keys, an
1273   * exception is raised (see below for more info).
1274   *
1275   * <p>If an existing value is set for the model's key, <b>it will be replaced</b>. In most object-based storage
1276   * engines this will end up copying the object, rather than mutating a key. Keys are usually immutable for this
1277   * reason, so use this method with care. Passing {@link Optional#empty()} will clear any existing key message
1278   * currently affixed to the model {@code instance}.</p>
1279   *
1280   * @param builder Model instance builder to splice the value into. The builder provided is <i>mutated in place</i>, so
1281   *                it will be an identical object instance to the one provided, but with the key property filled in.
1282   * @param val Value we should splice-into the key field for the record. It is expected that the generic type of this
1283   *            value will line up with the key message type, otherwise a {@link ClassCastException} will be thrown.
1284   * @param <Builder> Type of model builder we are splicing a key value into.
1285   * @param <Key> Type of key message we are splicing into the model.
1286   * @return Model builder, after splicing in the provided message, at the model's key-annotated field.
1287   * @throws InvalidModelType If the specified model is not suitable for use with keys at all.
1288   * @throws ClassCastException If the {@code Value} generic type does not match the key field primitive type.
1289   * @throws MissingAnnotatedField If the provided {@code builder} is not of the correct type, or has no key field.
1290   */
1291  public static @Nonnull <Builder extends Message.Builder, Key extends Message> Builder spliceKeyBuilder(
1292    @Nonnull Message.Builder builder,
1293    @Nonnull Optional<Key> val) {
1294    // resolve descriptor and key message field
1295    var descriptor = builder.getDescriptorForType();
1296    enforceRole(descriptor, DatapointType.OBJECT);
1297    var fieldPath = keyField(descriptor)
1298      .orElseThrow(() -> new MissingAnnotatedField(descriptor, FieldType.KEY))
1299      .getPath();
1300
1301    return spliceArbitraryField(
1302      builder,
1303      builder,
1304      fieldPath,
1305      val,
1306      fieldPath);
1307  }
1308}
